active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Generate 3 plausible distractors per MCQ: 1) Common misconception (e.g., confuse direct/transitive deps), 2) Partial truth (e.g., mentions vuln but wrong tool), 3) Extreme/overgeneralization (e.g., 'SCA eliminates all OSS risks').
Base on real-world errors from research (e.g., ignoring transitive deps in Log4Shell).
Ensure one distractor is a frequent tool mix-up (e.g., Snyk vs. Mend capabilities).

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Software Composition Analysis (SCA) within the topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Cloud Service Models > Cross-Model Security Controls > DevSecOps and Security Automation > SCA. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards optimized for spaced repetition and active recall, following university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy objectives [INSERT learning_objectives ARRAY HERE], active learning ties [e.g., reference discussion on Log4Shell], and 4 scaffolding layers [INSERT scaffolding_layers HERE]. Prioritize prior knowledge links (CVEs, deps, OSS). Use EXACTLY this flashcard schema [INSERT flashcard_schema HERE]. Ensure coverage: 30% Layer 1-2 (foundation), 40% Layer 3 (apply), 30% Layer 4 (integrate/create). Incorporate research: SCA detects OSS/third-party vulns/licenses via SBOM; tools like Mend/Snyk; risks like supply chain attacks. Output as JSON array of objects: [{'type': 'MCQ|Short|Scenario', 'front': '...', 'back': {'correct_answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': 1-4, 'tags': ['OSS', 'SBOM']}}]. No extra text.
